snippet: A start-up has its sights on the long-haul freeway driving that is the bread and butter of the commercial trucking industry.
abstract: Otto, start-up led by former Google engineers, is working to create self-driving big-rig trucks; says developing expensive self-driving technology for commercial trucking industry before automobiles makes sense financially and more acceptable to regulators; some experts express concern that autonomous trucks would impact American economy by killing jobs for commercial drivers and small towns and peripherals that cater to them.
lead_paragraph: A start-up has its sights on the long-haul freeway driving that is the bread and butter of the commercial trucking industry.

headline.main: Want to Buy a Self-Driving Car? Big-Rig Trucks May Come First
headline.print_headline: In a Move to Self-Driving Cars, Big-Rig Trucks May Come First
